google_play_reviews.content: It's a nice maps. I like it. But I will give a 5 stars soon when there is a save route button.
Very clear and good organized maps.
Amazing app, the only thing that I miss is satellite map

The best implementation of OSM data by far! There is turn by turn voice navigation, warnings for unpaved roads, ETA, ability to bookmark locations, search POI, etc. Walk, bike, drive, and public transport directions. Donate!!!

Please add the option to save routes. Update 1: So you don't misunderstand me: I am not referring to the possibility of recording(track) the route. I would like that after designing the route (crossing points), it can be saved. I wish to be able to reload a saved route. Update 2: I prepare the route for the whole day: ~20 POI. When I exit the app, the planning is lost. It takes me 20 minutes to reprogram the route. This is the reason why I want to be able to save (and load) a planned route.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: As we mentioned, it is planned :) What is your use-case for that saved route later? What would you do with it? Start navigating on it?

google_play_reviews.content: Amazing and an absolute godsend on a recent holiday - I can't thank the developers enough.
Fast, efficient orientation app. Detailed, easy to manage, simple favorites import and export, extremely usefull. Special thanks from one who was a veteran of Mapswithme...
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Many thanks to you from the people who created MapsWithMe years ago. Enjoy Organic Maps!

google_play_reviews.content: It's the best OSM app I've used so far. However, it doesn't replace Google Maps for me since there are no reviews or pictures, so when looking for places to go it's of no use really imo. (I've seen a GitHub issue suggestion about this, hope it's implemented!) Just for navigation, but if I already have the place open in Google Maps, why bother? Another suggestion is to implement questions about missing data when visiting places. GMaps makes it easy to contribute so they have tons of updated info
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Gmaps also tracks you, and all your contributions there belong to Google )

We plan a lot of improvements. Itâ€™s only a question of time when they will be implemented.

google_play_reviews.content: Fast, detailed, and accurate. It's better than Google Maps in every respect. Best of all, it's an open source project.
Fantastic ðŸ˜Š
Really neat UI, but I can't seem to download maps in the background when I'm in WiFi. As soon as I switch to another app, the download stops progressing. OnePlus Nord 2, OxygenOS12
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Does your system kill Organic Maps (and other apps) when you switch to another app? Does OM start instantly after switching back to it? If not, then itâ€™s killed. You can try to disable system energy settings, or somehow exclude OM. Or check Developer Settings about background processes. Please tell us more details at android@organicmaps.app

google_play_reviews.content: Love it. Carries on where Maps.me screwed up.
Excellent responsive maps with easy offline downloads. Clean, lean, and mean!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thatâ€™s very strange. Pinch zoom works on all our devices. Can you please provide us more details at android@organicmaps.app so we can debug and fix this issue for your device? Maybe record a video of a failed pinch-zoom attempt?

google_play_reviews.content: Best offline maps app. The only thing I'm missing is public transport plans and the option to choose from different routes.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Both are planned. With our usersâ€™ donations and support we can implement these and other features sooner ;-)

google_play_reviews.content: Seems free, thanks
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you! The app is free. We don't include any ads, in-app purchases, or other fees. Instead, we rely on donations from users to support and develop the project further.

google_play_reviews.content: I was Here user for a lot of years! After that i was try a lot navigation! This one, works as charm and without scum! Thank you!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for your support and trust! If you ever need to import information from other apps, just know that you can do so by importing KML files into Organic Maps.

google_play_reviews.content: I can see myself using this app often. Doesn't have the whistles and bells of a paid for app, but hard to fault an app that does the job for free without adverts
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks! What kind of bells and whistles do you need? :)

google_play_reviews.content: Thank You, Thank You. This map is great. It works! As a former MAPS.ME user and "map junkie". I love the fact that it is simple, does not have all of the useless baggage AND WORKS. I dont need routes, the fun is finding my own route. You would be surprised at what you find.
The good version of maps.me
Best free and fast Maps.Me replacement. Thank you saving one of the best apps.
Great maps for bicycle, thank you very much!
This app is darn near as good as Google Maps.

I am loving this. It's a great effort of many people bringing you something meaningful and useful. Being able to get the maps you need or want is great. Please move night mode toggle to the app's home screen for better accessibility.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks! What are your use-cases for toggling the dark/light modes often?

google_play_reviews.content: When I search for a place the list is not sorted by distance from current location. Makes searches almost useless.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Please, write us at support@organicmaps.app more details, like your search query and expected results.
Search is not always sorted by distance, for example, cities like "New York" should be on top even if it is thousands of kilometers from you.

google_play_reviews.content: Nice
One thing application need is tracking Upd. Yes. Track recorder:)
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Do you mean Track Recorder? It is planned. Organic Maps is privacy-focused, and it DOES NOT TRACK USERS :)

google_play_reviews.content: It would be nice if the map layers are still missing. I still need to go to the house so you can set them. The location is missing. The map layers do not have satellite map layers. There is no shortcut navigation yet, so only 2 stars. The problem is that it takes a long time to go offline navigation.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Satellite imagery is planned. Regarding other issues, can you please clarify them to us at android@organicmaps.app so we can help you? You can start navigation by selecting by a single or a long tap any point on the map and then press â€žToâ€œ. Some time may be needed under a clear sky to detect your location after pressing â€žcrosshairâ€œ button.

google_play_reviews.content: Fantastic App! It does everything I want it to do. I was enabled to rebuild my application of maps and many many bookmarks after my previous application no longer worked after several downloads and updates. All my previous work has now been saved. Thank you for this App!
Far better free maps than Google or Ordnance Survey for hiking, rambling, walking etc. Well done team on keeping it FOSS and non intrusive. Good work - 5 stars.
Beautiful thank you
Best of 2023 offline Map
Such a beautiful application. Free No ads. Functional. Highly recommended
Fake map... erooor!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Can you please clarify your issue? What does it mean â€žfake mapâ€œ? All maps data comes from OpenStreetMap.org

google_play_reviews.content: Brilliant app for use when hiking. You've got all the OSM paths and information, plus contours, plus the ability to download maps. And ad-free.
Best thing that mapsMe could've became, no "inyerface" wallet, no unnecessary feature blob that one became. Love you guys
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks a lot for your support. Enjoy the maps!

google_play_reviews.content: Much better than google maps, thank you!

First experience- used to use maps.me but that has become unworkable. This is faster, more reliable, search is better. Are you the guys who did maps.me before they were sold on? This is the sort of program I need.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Yes, we are )

google_play_reviews.content: Just found this app, really like that it shows my direction of travel when hiking, one tap on the compass toggles fixed or directional view. Would like to see a breadcrumbs feature that can be saved as gpx file I used mapsme before had trouble downloading the maps, this works great.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much! Gpx format support is in our plans.

google_play_reviews.content: Want to have a opportunity to save my routs.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We too! Itâ€™s planned ;-)

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Why 3 stars?

google_play_reviews.content: Better than Maps.me. It shows narrow paths in different color (not maps.me) and when screen lock, no need to unlock phone to see the map, great! It would be useful as well, the ruler like in Maps.me.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Ruler is planned )

google_play_reviews.content: Superb app ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ðŸ‘
best one! works with OSM data, ads free
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you. Enjoy using our maps!

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent app, just does what it needs to, well and quickly. Please don't make it bloated and slow with unnecessary features (like a certain "cousin" app!). Thank you guys ðŸ˜€
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unnecessary features made by a certain "cousin" app are the reason why we decided to make Organic Maps. Thank you for your review.

google_play_reviews.content: Great detail when expanded!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you! The maps are truly detailed thanks to our map data source. We take map data from OpenStreetMap.org, a collaborative platform similar to Wikipedia where anyone, including you, can edit or update the data.

google_play_reviews.content: It's crashing the OS all the time when I use the app for a long time (Pixel 7, Android 13)
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Wow, that's very strange. Can you please send us more details at googleplay@organicmaps.app? Can you also enable logs in OM settings, restart OM, and then share logs with us via "Report a bug" in Help dialog? Or send us a crash log recorded vua "adb logcat" command? Btw, did you disable the system WebView in your device's settings?

google_play_reviews.content: HATED THIS APP. TOTALLY USELESS. Program doesn't register actual street numbers. Can't navigate unless location is on No turn by turn navigation. Very hard to even figure out how to put navigation request in
google_play_reviews.replyContent: OM uses addresses from OpenStreetMap.org project. It is like Wikipedia for maps, where everyone, including you, can add or edit missing buildings and addresses. It is unfair to blame us for missing addresses, because we are responsible for the app, not for the maps data. Please tell us more details at googleplay@organicmaps.app so we can help you.

google_play_reviews.content: Nice! Offline and free
Simply wonderful
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks a lot. It's a pleasure to hear that.

google_play_reviews.content: Great application for offline.
Great OpenSource map application with privacy in mind. Highly appreciated.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks a lot for your feedback! This means a lot to us.

google_play_reviews.content: Great, simple and blazing fast. Very useful navigation without internet
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for your review!

google_play_reviews.content: The great old original Maps.ME before capitalism spoiled it. Thanks developers!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you! Organic Maps are cofounded and supported by the people who initially created Maps.me in 2011. We hope to improve the functionality and usability of Organics maps, making them better than any other map application, including Maps.me at its peak.

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent FOSS app.
Saved life in a forest in India, where Google maps doesn't even open, this app worked like a pro.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Wow! Thanks a lot for sharing your review.

google_play_reviews.content: Works great! No issues with it so far.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: It's a pleasure to hear that. We hope you will not meet any issues but if it ever happens don't hesitate to contact us at android@organicmaps.app.

google_play_reviews.content: Mapping features not as rich as Google. Needs more development. Label Building needs to be added to list of placemarkers for example. Tags are a handy feature in GMaps to identify "home" and "work". Developer responsiveness is fast - great work guys!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Can you please elaborate on label buildings? What is it about? Home and work are planned.

google_play_reviews.content: It's very accurate

google_play_reviews.content: Great app
Really nice offline map
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you! Why only 4 stars then? ;-)

google_play_reviews.content: No ads.

[Couldn't reproduce the issue, so back to 5 stars] Nice clean UI, open source, using awesome OSM. What's not to like? I'm looking forward to seeing what the developers' plans are for this, but it's already pretty great.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Can you please provide us more details at android@organicmaps.app ? OM doesnâ€™t work in background. The only feature that may be related to background activity is to upload OpenStreetMap.org edits (if any) when the network is available. Can you please enable logs in OM settings, reproduce the issue and â€ž?â€œ -> Report a bug?

google_play_reviews.content: Fantastic app
Would Organic map support Garmin watch or wear OS?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: If many users donate, then it may be possible. Or small team of enthusiasts works in our free time, on the completely free app ;-)

google_play_reviews.content: fast, has offline maps, was able to find anything so far
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! If you find any missing data, you can update it on the OpenStreetMap.org project. Organic Maps uses data from this project.

google_play_reviews.content: Good experience
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Why only 4 stars then?

google_play_reviews.content: Useless. Can't find my location, even after reading the FAQ & following the advice, the app still cannot find my location. 2 other offline GPS apps worked fine to locate my position precisely once I enabled the location. Hi, Per your request, I've enable the log, restart the app, it still couldn't find my location. So, Sent bug report. Updated the review: 5 stars! Developer responded immediately to remedy the issue, problems solved. Great Apps to use! Great support, appreciate it!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: That is very weird. Do these other apps show an approximate network position, or precise GPS one? Can you please enable logs in OM settings, restart OM, try to find your position by pressing the crosshair button under the + and - buttons, and wait for about a minute? Then, if it doesn't work, please share logs with us via "?" -> Report a bug.

google_play_reviews.content: A nice free offline map app. It works well on many phones, but rendering of roads and text seems a bit slow unless you are zoomed in. I like how you can help improve the maps by adding points of interest or other useful information. Very detailed trail and outdoor maps as well. Thanks for the great app and helping save the environment!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your support!

google_play_reviews.content: Awesome app!
great detailed maps, clean fast ui. sadly public transport routing doesn't seem to work in graz/austria :/ (trams and busses to clarify)
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Is there a metro system in Graz? At the moment, only metro and light-rails are supported. We'll improve it over time with your support and donations ;-)

google_play_reviews.content: Loved it . Are you guys from turkey? I mean you developers???
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Originally no, but we like Turkey and enjoy visiting it )

google_play_reviews.content: Simply superb

I'v not had this app long, but have used it plenty already. Superb. Fast & smooth to use, accurate tracking. No fussy controls. Really really pleased with it, thank youðŸ‘Œ I left a four star rating (maybe a bit mean of meðŸ¤”) because although I can't fault the app, I could find it much more useful if a legend (key) for the tracks & symbols was included.... Edit: Dev responded immediately & advised me to long tap on objects for info. Genius! Thank you! ðŸ˜ Upgraded to 5*
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Try a long-tap anywhere to get more info about the object. Hope it deserves 5 stars ;-)

google_play_reviews.content: Fast offline free best for iran
Good
Wow, it's amazing app. Excellant
It works offline. Thank you!
Wonderful app!!!
You have to download your area map again in this app thats irritating
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Do you store maps on SD card? Did you eject it recently, or connected it to the PC? It may lead to disconnecting the SD from Organic Maps storage. Please set storage back to SD card, or use the internal storage in this case. If it is not your case, then please tell us more details at android@organicmaps.app so we can help you and fix the issue.

google_play_reviews.content: Love that you went back to the old functionality of maps.me. No stupid ads or hotels, just OSM.
it is a good offline map app, as per my expirience, it has a more detailed map than its closest counterpart
Exellent
All you need. Free app no adds with free open source offline maps. Basic interface with option to set points of interest. Super for hiking.

Something happened to altitudes since the update. In the country where the topmost peak is less then 5k high, a casual road through higlhlands which in reality is no higher then 1.5k above the sea, boasts a 7000 climb and a 5000 descend. Maps update solves nothing. I'd say one of the most used feature of these maps got broken.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Can you please send us starting and ending points together with a screenshot at android@organicmaps.app, so we can check it and fix, if necessary?

google_play_reviews.content: This is a simple, free and ad free navigation app that just works. I have discovered so many great places on foot and found tracks not available on other maps. I highly recommend it. It has far exceeded my expectations for a free app. Some improvements at the time of writing could be finer contours (in many parts of the world it is 50m).
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks! We have a great plan to rewrite contour lines and add hillshading. With your donations and support it happens faster )

google_play_reviews.content: Could be a good map, but the terrain overlay is near useless. The contour lines are often inaccurate and there are not enough increments to determine any meaningful topographical information. This app is well suited for cities, but not for hiking. Please work on the terrain features of this app :)
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Improving the terrain model is planned, but it is a very complex task, and require a lot of time to implement. With your donations our small team working in our free time on our completely free app can move faster. Also, it is a bit unfair to give Organic Maps 2 stars for something we can not improve quickly considering all other issues.

google_play_reviews.content: Simple and easy to use maps. Im impressed

I would really like to simply save a location, and then later have the app point me in the direction of that location, just like a normal Garmin hiking GPS can do. Edit: I didn't know that functionality existed! It didn't occur to me to tap on the little arrow by the location description to get directional navigation directly to that point. I look forward to trying it out on my next trip.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Can you please clarify, what exactly does not work for you? You can select any place on the map with a tap (or long-tap) on it, and then bookmark it by pressing a star icon in the bottom bar. Later, at any time, you can select this bookmark and tap an arrow icon to have a compass-like directions, if there are no roads, or "Route To" if there are.

google_play_reviews.content: Love the app, functions well. Not sure about the new interface with buttons all over the place, much prefer the pre October 2022 version with menu bar at the bottom. The new interface is to show more map, exactly in a position where there's no need to see.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Many users want to see more map on the screen, it helps to navigate more efficiently in different scenarios. Toolbars are not helping much in many cases. We tried to make the change as minimally intrusive as possible. What is your use-case, so you donâ€™t need to see more maps?

google_play_reviews.content: Amazing app
Smooth, fast, easy to use, reliable, free and open-source.
I like it atlist add speedometre
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can see the current speed when you select a blue position arrow. We plan to add a speed indicator too in the future.

google_play_reviews.content: I like it :>

Works OK 95% of the time. The other 5% is trying to take you on completely ridiculous routes and even at times off cliffs, down riverbeds and through farmers fields. Has no route options. Better to use Google maps.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Wait, there are route options, check Organic Maps settings. Organic Maps uses maps data from OpenStreetMap.org project, it's like Wikipedia, where everyone, including you, can help to fix wrong routes, addresses, or add new buildings. Please sen us more details about your issues in the app, with starting and ending points, so we can check & fix it.

google_play_reviews.content: Nice tool for OSM maps! Moover not russian...

This app is an excellent alternative to Google Maps. That being said, it does lack a few quality of life features (such as Android Auto support, which is coming in a branch on GitHub). My only real gripe is a big one though - it doesn't always navigate you to the exact location of landmarks (for example, Disney Springs sends you to the valet pickup instead of the entrance).
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please report your issue in details on our GitHub.

google_play_reviews.content: Give me a map, my track and my location ... that's all I need. (Ok, elevation profiles would be nice.) No frills, no BS, no constant begging for money. No more feature creep and UI cancer like you-know-who.
Very helpful and useful. Thank youðŸ‘ðŸ‘
Faultless for ease of use from initial maap downloads to offline use e.g. Route me by foot to the nearest W.C.
Great app for hiking and such, seeing detailed information of the world around you. Has way more info on trails than Google Maps for example
Good offline maps with out advertising.
Great for navigating and getting your bearings. Does what it says on the tin and you can help with edits or adding new businesses easily.
Brilliant. Way faster, way cleaner, and way more user-friendly than Osmand.
perfect, keep going developer never give up give the best on this app

It's great to have the original Maps.me functionality back. This version is just so much easier to use and write up descriptions for your Bookmarks and categories. I have been using the older Maps.me for years offline when I travel overseas as to not use data connection and this make that again possible with Organic Maps. The only draw back I have is I just can't find a way to sort my bookmarks. You can sort the locations within the bookmarks, but not the bookmarks itself...
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You mean to sort lists of bookmarks? Or bookmarks themselves inside each list? By alphabet?

google_play_reviews.content: Orgainic Maps is what an offline, works anywhere, travel map app should be. Works very well with the GPS of my Samsung A51 5G. Is intuitive and very easy to use. Building, saving, and using bookmarks to build a route is quick and easy. Building a route from your current position to a bookmark is even easier. This is one of my favorite apps.
Honest and working good

I really like that the default map design here fits so many outdoor activities without having to configure anything. If you quickly open the app you instantly get an idea of the area around you, because the visuals are just intuitive.
Very good maps for travelling on bicycle
loving it!
Most user friendly map app there is!

I came to this app from Maps.Me which in recent times has become far too commercialised. Organic is just perfect for my needs and looks like Maps.Me did originally. Fast and accurate. Easy to amend via OpenStreetMap.

Nice map, easy to use and many features. However Hong Kong is not part of Guangdong and it would be great to only download the map for Hong Kong. The search also falsly claims all places as Guangdong.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback, this issue is already on our Github. We need to refactor the code working with regions to properly split them. Please stay tuned :)

google_play_reviews.content: Super readable and fast map, POI shows up at reasonable zoom level, very simple user interface, however I wish the app could show alternative routes kinda like Google Maps or Magic Earth.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Alternate routes are planned. Your stars motivate us to work even more in our free time on our free app ;-)

google_play_reviews.content: Great app
Great app! Wish we could import our own GPX files though for additional hiking trails that might be missing.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: GPX is planned, as a workaround you can convert GPX to KML, and import it :)

google_play_reviews.content: I am so happy to have regained the old Maps.me that has been my trusty companion (and saviour!) on so many mountain hikes throughout Europe. As others have written, the recent updates have ruined Maps.me. I lost patience with it on today's hike and uninstalled. This is the old Maps.me. Thank you! One continiuing frustration: when I search for a place name that's marked on the map it often doesn't show up in the list, e.g. Caspoggio (Sondrio province, Italy).
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please check the search in the upcoming update and let us know if it is still doesn't work well, with all details (viewport, your approximate position, the exact search query) at android@organicmaps.app

google_play_reviews.content: Nice.
Excellent product

This has all the good features of the old Maps.me plus more: - one tap saving of bookmark edits - description field is not restricted to a stupidly short length - the map view of a route is most of the screen, unlike the current version of Maps.me - bookmark lists load quickly even if they have hundreds of entries (again unlike Maps.me) - the bonus feature is that if you have the app open when you turn off your phone, it will be available again without having to enter your pin or password!

Already love it! Does exactly what I want without all the extra bull that other hiking apps add to make you pay for a subscription. The only thing I am missing here is the ability to import gpx routes and record my own routes with details, and to export them. Then this would be the perfect app!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: These features are planned, there is no need to decrease the rating to motivate us work harder in our free time on our free app :)

google_play_reviews.content: This application is excellent replacement for "Maps.Me", which has gone ashtray. I was able to import all my bookmarks from previous travels. So far working as expected. Way to go, "Organic Maps"!

Perfect! I was sad to see mapsme lose its best features. Very happy to find this. I enjoy maps and find this to have the ideal balance of features and the interface is the best. Very thankful to the developers!

I admire your work, fellas! You saved maps.me for us, so here is our gratitude to you :) For the users: when travelling in the nature, it's almost always better than google maps, i think, - simply because of all the routes and trails presented. Be careful though and consider checking hard-to-reach routes, as it not always knows wether a road is in good condition or not.
Very good
Amazing! Thanks

Just downloaded last night and I can already tell it's going to be one of my favourite apps for outdoors walks. The only things I think are "missing" are the ability to add unlimited waypoints/stops on a route, and the hill contours aren't very detailed when compared to other maps. The contours don't show enough detail when you zoom in closer. Edit: thanks for the response, maybe I was doing something wrong with waypoints. Can't wait for the contour updates.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Itâ€™s a free app, weâ€™re working in our free time instead of spending it with our families. So no promises :)

Hope for 5 stars from you soon.

google_play_reviews.content: Zoom in super close to find something, annoying. Stop copying stupid Google anti clutter policy, maps supposed to show stuff, not look clean.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks, but we are not copying Google. There are technical reasons why the world map is empty now, we have some ideas on how to fix that, and avoid large (gigabyte) apk sizes, or long waiting for users until the world map will be downloaded. Please join our GitHub community or Telegram/Matrix groups to discuss and provide feedback.

google_play_reviews.content: I want to love it. It works like old maps.me, but I can't download new maps. It's says my phone is full, i have ten gigs of free space and it says I'm not connected to the internet, but my wifi is functioning just fine with every other app. I've granted all permissions... Not sure why the trouble.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Please enable logs in OM settings, try to reproduce any error, and then send us logs via â€œ?â€ -> Report a bug

Looks like you have some customizations like a firewall app/config or something else. Letâ€™s debug it to help you.

google_play_reviews.content: Great app! Clear, fast and simple to use. Mainly use it for hiking and biking so importing routes (kml) is important to me. Didn't try navigation yet. Used MapsMe for years before, but their recent updates messed a lot of things up.
Perfect

This is what maps.me was 5-10 years ago. Then it became a bloted and restrictive nightmare, that forced you to create an account to manage bookmarks, and slowed down the app with ads and other useless stuff. Please dont follow in their footsteps! Keep it simple, the way it is! I dont want to book flight or hotels , or make coffe with a map app. Focus and be good at one thing, not mediocre at many things. Super happy that I found your app. Replacing maps.me with Organic Maps on all of my devices!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks, we're trying to focus on most important things )

google_play_reviews.content: Great OSM map navigator! Thanks for following the simple fork off a previous app. Keep it up!! Would it be possible to export bookmark file as KML, as well as KMZ? ( allowing opening on PC, editing, and reimport)
google_play_reviews.replyContent: KML export works now, select it in the bookmarks list menu.

google_play_reviews.content: Awesome Open Street Map client : Open Source, no ads, no registration, no tracking, good for privacy
Why didn't I come across this earlier?! Maps.me turned to the dark side, so I'm glad this fast and easy to use app is out there:-)
very fast. quite simple and clear interface. recommend to use
My favorite osm map, please add more maps like open hiking maps ore open cycling maps
google_play_reviews.replyContent: It's not easy to add additional map styles, but we plan to do it.

google_play_reviews.content: This is how maps.me was when it was good. I hope they won't change the way it works now, because it's perfect
Super
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Why only one star?

google_play_reviews.content: Great apps.now I will use this one where ever I go.
Great navigation and maps app that works offline. Can route walks, car rides, bike rides, and subway trips. Uses the open source OpenStreetMap dataset

Great offline map that I mainly use for OSM POIs, shows opening hours. Even has a basic editing functionality to easily improve OSM data. Also renders buildings in 3D which is a nice touch. This is a fork of maps.me before it went a different path. To anyone who is complaining about data quality - OSM is a community driven project. The more people improve it, the better is the data, same as with Wikipedia. StreetComplete is a great app for data improving if you are interested.

Good - map is awailable without unlocking the phone; Bad - the app accepts random input while in the pocket - it tries to open pages, call phones, etc. It never happens in Locus Maps, meaning it can be solved without disabling the useful feature completely.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Do you lock the phone before putting it into the pocket? If yes, we canâ€™t control the unlock button which is pressed while in the pocket. If no, please try to lock the phone before putt it into the pocket.
It would be great to also get more details from you how exactly it works in other apps and doesnâ€™t work with OM by email android@organicmaps.app

google_play_reviews.content: Simply perfect. It is fast and has just the essentials, no fluf! One thing missing though is a legend for the elements of the maps. For example, what that red lined area stands for. With response to the awesome makers of it: Simply awesome, thank you!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Make a long tap on any object to see its description.

google_play_reviews.content: Perfect!! Just like Maps.me.... but better! ...And far, far better than awful Google maps. No added unnecessary bloat. Just works, and works well.
Looks great and faster than maps.me.
Good app but unfortunately until now it's useless for North Africa, maybe I'll check it later.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We take all data from OpenStreetMap.org, please contribute any map data there and youâ€™ll get a detailed map sooner.

google_play_reviews.content: Works very well and superfast. Navigation is ok, but has some minor quirks, hence only 4 stars. Route for bike takes an unnecessary detour, and estimated trip time for car route is much shorter than real travel time. Otherwise a very usable app. Would still recommend it to others.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Can you please send us examples of wrong routes and ETAs at android@organicmaps.app, so we can improve our algorithms?

google_play_reviews.content: Ð½Ð°ÑÐ»ÐµÐ´Ð½Ð¸Ðº ÑÑ‚Ð°Ñ€Ð¾Ð³Ð¾, Ð´Ð¾Ð±Ñ€Ð¾Ð³Ð¾ maps me
Just downloaded today, but so far looks great. I like the ability to import bookmarks. Could not get export to work on my phone, but could email bookmarks to myself, so that is all good.
Old good MapsMe

6 stars is more appropriate. AAAA1++++. been using Maps.Me for donkeys years. then an update bricked it into oblivion. And alas poor Maps.Me I knew it well. RIP . this app is just spot on. I cycled width of Pyrenees no issue . thank thank thank you thank you thank you thank you. I am forever I debt of this app
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Youâ€™re welcome ;-)

google_play_reviews.content: Easy, free, useful
An excellent replacement for the deceased Maps.me
Sweet sweet open-source, thnx guys!
Open-source remake of maps.me. Looks very promising. Update: offline maps dowloads are failing. Still failing. And still (2021-12). Update: it finally works!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Great news! We fixed maps downloading once and for all! Please try the latest version.

google_play_reviews.content: Thank you for your hard work on this app!
Simple, robust and powerful offline navigation app.
Worked in places I least expected.
Good app but address search is as bad as OSM. Dunno how magic maps do it so well, pity as the UI in this app is far more polished than magic maps
google_play_reviews.replyContent: They mix in addressed from other (potentially paid) sources, or use some API. We have some ideas on improving it.

google_play_reviews.content: Was very good, but now if you want to go somewhere, it doesn't know where you are, even though your location is turned on, so no route is marked. It worked before the update, but totally useless now. Add a starting point to plan a route keeps coming up - it should know where I am!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: This dialog means that your location is not detected. What happened when you press a "crosshair" button to enable GPS location in Organic Maps? Does your device have location services enabled? Do other apps work properly and detect your location? Please let us know so we can fix the issue.

google_play_reviews.content: Best maps ever

Tried this sat nav and all looks good however I've got a problem with this software. 1) I connected my phone to the Mondeo Bluetooth but always set sat navs to come through phone speaker that couldn't be achieved infact I got no sound at all. 2) The sat nav runs smooth when I have a route to go to but when no route is plotted it's very notchy not smooth at all infact unusable really as it runs slow and lags behind. My phone is a pixel running the latest software. I hope their is a fix
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Could you please record a short video of lags (notchy not smooth) and send us on android@organicmaps.app ?

google_play_reviews.content: Love it!
great app, thanks
Great open source maps!
the best
Excellent app, fast and clean

As I long time user of Maps.Me I was delighted to stumble across OrganicMaps which seems to be all the best of Maps.Me but minus the monetisation drive. I have just deleted Maps.me and plan on using Organic Maps as my primary maping tool from now. I would happily pay a subscription but until that is an option I will just make a donation. I will be giving this app a big shout out to all my hiking and cycling friends. We need to collectively raise the profile of this brilliant app!

Nice app for offline navigation. The best feature for this app is it's simplicity, not having unnecessary gimmicky features. One feature I would recommend having is showing the speed limits. The implementation of the night mode is also weird, in auto night mode, only the navigation screen is dark, not the whole app, making it a bit blinding to start the app. Hope this is fixed soon. Overall the app has great potential, but still needs some way to go.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The current dark/light setting is in "Navigation" subsection. It needs some fixes, you're right. There is a big issue about it on our GitHub.

google_play_reviews.content: Fantastic location map lots of thanks
Just installed. very good. the map is not as detail as Mapwithme.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Which area are you comparing? Both apps use the same OpenStreetMap data.

google_play_reviews.content: Good app!
Great app
Very good Sir
Better than maps.me. Not owned by a faceless corporation either.
I really enjoyed the offline service ðŸ‘ðŸ»
Awesome
Great open-source, OpenStreetMaps-based alternative to Google Maps. Good also for offline navigation.

This app is currently the best replacement for a Google Maps experience. It's easy to look at. It beats OsmAnd for design and ease-of-use. It's snappy and responsive like GM never was. What keeps this from fully replacing GM is not an issue with the app but with the data. For example, Open Street Map - that's the name of the map data - probably doesn't include the house number you are looking for. You will likely find the street, but beyond that you'll need to use your wits.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Well, you can always add missing houses or house numbers into the OpenStreetMap data. Organic Maps allows to add/edit some basic missing features.

google_play_reviews.content: It is simple and easy to use. Does not drain battery like other apps, foss, cross platform, etc.
Fantastic App. Got rid of maps.me as it became bloatware.

google_play_reviews.content: The best outdoor GPS I have seen in many years! Please keep it as it is: simple, fast and light on the resources! I would like louder voice instructions when I'm cycling in noisy traffic (I already have all Android system sound cursors set to the max).
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks! Do you think itâ€™s possible to make it louder? Are other apps louder? You may add an issue to our Github with your device description, we also check it.

google_play_reviews.content: I want to like this app but it just doesn't work in any useful sense. Two addresses in my town in a large metro with the offline area map downloaded returned a) the whole street, not the actual address, and b) either the whole street (again) or streets with the same name in nearby towns but not my town. When an address or street is found, the app returns to the map view but doesn't zoom in to the area it found, so it seems like it didn't find anything. Address search is very slow, too.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Sorry for the inconvenience. Could you please write us your town's name and search addresses on support@organicmaps.app
Do you store maps in SD? SD cards may be very slow. Do addresses you search for exist in OpenStreetMap? We take all maps data from there. There are also some ranking issues with search that will be fixed soon.

google_play_reviews.content: Well done
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you!

google_play_reviews.content: The old classic Maps.me alternative
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Wait for new features ;-)

google_play_reviews.content: Found it. 2 hours later it replaced another similar app. Keep it going
google_play_reviews.replyContent: ðŸ‘

google_play_reviews.content: This is maybe aimed more at users migrating from maps.me. For me marking the places as bookmarks is the most important aspect of travel planning. Organic Maps stores the bookmarks in an inaccessible folder (you need to root your device to have the access). The only way to backup this user data is to use a Google service, which is not what I want, or exporting the bookmarks manually, and individually for each bookmark list. Unfortunately, all the user data is also removed if you uninstall the application. The latest update caused the app to become unable to start, so, having no other option, I reinstalled it. This removed all the bookmarks. In maps.me, an app I migrated from, the bookmark files are easily accessible locally and every time you add some places to your bookmarks the bookmark files are updated. Also, all the user files are kept intact if you are forced to reinstall the application. In these aspects, Organic Maps seems like a beta still, when compared with maps.me.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We are sorry :( As we wrote you in the email, MapsMe does not follow Google's requirements yet. But they should do it if they want to update the app in November and later. It is Google's requirement to stop using folder which is accessible by users. We plan to add backup/sync feature, together with "Export all bookmarks" button for manual backup.

google_play_reviews.content: Simple but all the better for it. Easy to use.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you!

google_play_reviews.content: I love maps.me:)
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Then youâ€™re in the right place ;-)

google_play_reviews.content: I like the automatic download (configurable), and the map rendering style. It's less flexible than OsmAnd but easier to get started.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Great! Please let us know what can be done better.

google_play_reviews.content: Organic Maps helped me and my friend to find our way home in the Swedish mountains when the weather suddenly changed and we ended up in a middle of a snow storm. We had no network connection most of the time and with everything covered in snow Organic Maps was our only hope to find the trail and get home safe. Misfortunes never come singly as they say, so in addition to snow, wind, coldness, and the famous Swedish winter darkness my phone battery was about to run out. To save the battery I switched into flight mode - Organic Maps kept working flawlessly. Organic Maps had enough details for us to follow the trail precisely using GPS. We could not see the trail because of the snow but we could follow it using GPS - so good OpenStreetMap data is. Compare how "FulufjÃ¤llet nationalpark" looks like in Google Maps vs OpenStreetMap and you will see what I am talking about. So yeah, if you plan to visit a remote region without getting lost in a dangerous situation then I can totally recommend Organic Maps. It served us well when our wellbeing depended on it.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Wow, thank you for sharing your experience! It motivates and inspires our small team and other users :)
We're so happy that you're safe. That was an adventure!

google_play_reviews.content: Amazing. Very smooth. Responsive developers. They respect privacy.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: True!

google_play_reviews.content: Fantastic continuation of Maps.Me, thank you for removing the bloat and adding new features.

google_play_reviews.content: Fantastic app and great alternative to Maps.me, perfect for discovering new walking trails or cycle paths. Keep up the good work!

google_play_reviews.content: Great app. Love it, only one but..... The anoying "location services is off" message when opening the app. Useless. I know it's off, i did that. Even then, if position is not shown/updated it's clear its off
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Sorry for that inconvenience. This is necessary because we received tons of claims before about position and very often users forget about location service on their device.

We plan to improve this experience soon, and to prompt only once in some period of time.

google_play_reviews.content: exact copy of maps.me ðŸ¤”ðŸ¤”
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We created MapsMe 10 years ago. Now we forked it, removed unnecessary features, focused on user experience, usability, and longer battery life.

google_play_reviews.content: Looks good. After converting my .gpx bookmarks to .kmz I have my bookmarks on the map. Routing works good ðŸ‘
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. What should we do to get 5 stars? :) GPX import is planned by the way.

google_play_reviews.content: Easy to use & open source app. Great work.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you! We're happy when our users are happy.

google_play_reviews.content: Best free offline navigator
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks! Navigator needs a lot of improvements, weâ€™ll make it even better.

google_play_reviews.content: The app looks very promising. What I like most is that the app is very fast. It downloads maps by itself _onto SD card_, the maps are pretty detailed with a lots of labels and infos, buildings are present as 3D-models, although crude, which eases the orientation. I that the app shows height profile while calculating a route for bicycle. On the flip side is that the maps are low-contrast, which makes observation in the daylight difficult. Road surface marking is barely present.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks for the detailed feedback! How would you suggest increasing the contrast for your use case? Any specific colors? Any good examples? Also, how do you expect to see and use the info about the road surface?
You may send us a detailed letter at android@organicmaps.app

google_play_reviews.content: An Very useful app the only suggestion is that u can even add Motorbike mode will he usefull for bikers coz bikers can't use express Highways in India
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks, we'll see what we can do. There is an option to avoid motorways, also you can add an additional stop for an alternative route.

google_play_reviews.content: The open source and privacy-first map application we deserveâ€”harnessing data from the excellent OpenStreetMap community. I just wish I could get updated maps! I'm very actively mapping my community and want to see the results without having to wait weeks or months. Wishing the developers luck and hoping that they keep improving and modernizing the app! (I am a sponsor on LiberaPay).
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Our small team is working hard on all bugs and requests. More frequent data updates are in our top priorities, with the goal to update data at least weekly. It also requires more disk space and more servers (every snapshot is more than 50Gb), so you may also support this process with your donations.
